poem:
Title: "The Language of Letters Lost"

Three days hence the postman's press,
As silence slips into address.
Each vanished day marks less to share,
Iron wings grounded by fare.
In clipped wings, the savings hidden,
Unsent words, love forbidden.
Saturday's spindle spins no more,
An alphabet washed up on the shore.
Sacrificed kinship on the altar of gold,
In the quiet, unsaid stories hold.
